name: mrclarinet
text:
I challenge somebody to do a comic using the Ruinous Habits / Fried foods / Ray / Cyrus West Field / Isambard Brunel ideas.

I don't have the stones to do it, but I know it's already forming in the imagination of somebody out there in internetland, and furthermore, I know it's AWESOME.

And I say that without know who Cyrus West Field is.

name: jordstar
text: I want to see one using "     " (two entries below Ray in the list) as the primary character.

name: earendil
text: The implication is clearly that Ray is the only primary character who is appropriately conducive to one-off self-entertainment strips.

name: jordstar
text: Self-entertainment... is that what he was using his hands for?

name: neonaoneo
text:
Yeah. He goes to the garage because he prefers the decorum for the activity. Restraining seatbelts, brake fluid and power drills, shit helps Ray get comfortable.

Did I just elude to Ray being into...I apologise.

name: earendil
text: A comment left by earendil was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by phthoggos, hellofyellin, illgamesh, brianstanwyck, Nictusempra)

name: mrclarinet
text: If I could give you one chubby for the strip summary and one for the Mike Gravel icon, I would.

name: mrclarinet
text: Ok, now do unpopular appliances/things that turn red/ray/teodor/a chair is ageing

name: belgand
text: Ray and Teodor discuss Ray's newest whimsical and wholly unnecessary purchase: a device that causes the lawn furniture to rust very quickly.

text: A comment left by straw was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by gothfae, d3athcann0n, valuedan, Shinkicka)

text: Ok, well that was maybe a little harsh.  I guess I was just venting my disappointment that I didn't see a comic recreated here.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: an hour. one whole hour of my night dedicated to making this Happen. i am SO hoping for chubbies for this.

name: drskradley
text: Your request is granted, but not because of your hoping.  I think everybody respects genuine effort.

name: earendil
text:
did you do this in photoshop or some other (less ridiculously expensive) program? I wanted to do this but lacked image editing...

Also chubbied. I feel like a scriptwriter now. Good thing the strike ended before yesterday.

name: lawbot
text: Try GIMP.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that's totally it!

name: lawbot
text: Of course. I pay attention.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: duly noted~

name: cpnglxynchos
text: made with a Program called [url=http://www.gimp.org/windows/]The Gimp[/u]. the best (well, only) Photoshop-style editor i've ever used. it's powerful enough to generate my avi and things like this, so i'm happy.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
The Gimp

...cursèd tag.

name: hellofditties
text: Definately worth the effort.  I even held my cursor over the stript expectantly, waiting for the alt text.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: repeat (and paraphrase) of another alt text: "You can do whatever you want in life."

name: baryonyx
text: Onstad, what have you done? You've forfeited all the power you held over we Acheworlders! No longer are you the hand that feeds us; you have granted us the ability to create Achewood strips without you, and in doing so you are the architect of your own demise!

name: hbaranov
text: This is the biggest event since the fall of the Roman Empire.

name: soticoto
text:
Negatory.
This is Onstad's primary form of reproduction. He is simply trying to implant us with his ways until we transform into copies of him... so he can get more work done.

name: tekende
text: I...I'm slightly ashamed to admit that after I read this comment, I hovered my cursor over it for a moment, waiting for the alt text.

name: fineoakstructure
text: See hellofditties comment just slightly above your comment, and or mine much further below.  You will find peace and grace, along with us other fuckwits with thumbs firmly planted.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, but I didn't do it on one of the images above. I did it on the script that earendil wrote. heh.

name: twotonturkey
text: What if Cyrus West Field is a place and a not a who?

name: ethelthefrog
text: Good point.

name: esselfortium
text: Cyrus West Field is a state of being.

name: sol_tee
text: maybe it is a condition

name: riazm
text: At around panel 5 I was confident instant messaging my friend to tell him that the new Achewood is amazing.

name: jamers
text: With comics like this one, I will often do anything to sate my curiosity... including reading the next panel.

name: straw
text: Up to and including?

name: jamers
text: Up to and including and I'll occasionally even post a turn of phrase I think is clever but is really just a rip off of the strip because I wasn't able to think of anything original to say.

name: kilroywashere
text:
[IMGS OFF]
Isambard Kingdom Brunel: HE GETS THINGS DONE

name: straw
text: When he reads this strip, he will imagine Ray was constructing a railroad.

name: zebra
text: This man just kicked Cathy in the head and collected the money she owed him.

name: geysershitdick
text: Why would anyone ever need chains that large? Seriously.

name: aikennubbles
text: The chains aren't really that large.  Isambard Kingdom Brunel was a leprechaun.

name: pyromancer
text: Try my lucky drapes! They're magically realistic!

name: falseprophet
text: You know a man with Kingdom in his name is compensating for something.

name: daidai
text: He probably has to act less awesome so his name doesn't intimidate people away!

name: illgamesh
text: This photograph is reproduced in Hollis Frampton's seminal "Circles of Confusion."  Does above poster enjoy both Styx and Frampton, or is it a coincidence of the merest degree?

name: spinynorman
text:
Something tells me Brunel is the specific catalyst for this foil, Cyrus West Field:

[IMGS OFF]

I assume the accompanying elements of the strip would be laying the Trans-Atlantic cable, gutta-percha cable sheathing, and oh yeah, Ray. As depicted above by cpnglxynchos.

Onstad is hella feeling the Nineteenth Century Trans-Atlantic communications today.

name: edwell
text: Perhaps he finally got around to his Christmas present from 2004 .

name: paradigmeyes
text: God I hate Cathy

name: falseprophet
text: Chubby for Trystero.

name: paradigmeyes
text: chubbied for chubbie

name: iidebaser
text: I remember being kind of annoyed when ray became achewood's Primary Character. I'd gotten attached to lyle and philippe and lie bot. what a fool I was!

name: nokococo
text: I miss Philippe and L.B.  Todd and Lyle?  Not so much.  But that's just me.

name: norrin
text: I am hoping it's cyclical. For a while it was the Philippe show. And also Beef. Actually when I started reading I thought Beef was THE main character.

name: beansdooma
text: those towels weren't gonna stack themselves.

name: epicurus
text: Now we don't need Chris Onstad anymore! This can supply days of entertainment!

name: spinynorman
text:
As of today I have had verbal arguments with a lightbulb, a rather scratched John Prine album, and three of my cabinets. Often the mysterious black bottle seen in Ray's hand had a lot to do with it.

I am still not on speaking terms with the John Prine album.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i wish i could give this more than one chubby

that is hilarious, man


...and no, i don't think you're kidding

name: powderfinger
text: I got 2 copies of Prime Prine, no sleeve but totally not scratched, iffin that happened to be the one given you troubles.

name: odei
text: I wish I had apologised to my old TV before it was taken away with the rubbish. Sure it was sketchy, and near the end it would turn itself on, change channels, and other wacky hijinks that scared the shit out of me at 1am, but it deserved more respect than I gave it. You'll have to excuse me, I'm getting all emotional.

name: spinynorman
text:
Every time I climb out of my car and leave my keys in the ignition it immediately goes BEEEEEEEEEEP, reminding me they're there, and then when I take them out I always cheerfully say, "Thanks, car!"

Put credit where it's due.

name: earendil
text: I like that Kitten and Jeeves are both back after the Great Acheworld Avatar Crisis of aught-eight.  (I personally will not be returning to the identity-crisis-prompting Abraham Lincoln, but I'm glad to see familiarity return.)

name: blarghamagarky
text: I also do this on occasion, also when I leave my lights on I am thankful for my helpful car.

name: spinynorman
text: Cars are some okay dudes.

name: foetus_punch
text:
WHAT THE HELL IS WITH EVERYONE SPEAKING LIKE MY FRIEND HAS SPOKEN TODAY. IS IT TALK PRETTY AWESOME DAY? Sorry for the caps. Should I...Should I say something clever and related now?

When I am at home alone, I often converse with furniture. I have named my fridge, cabinet, and computer. I am also always naked. Picture it, if you will: a bleary-eyed and slightly buzzed me, my goonies hanging about in a most unsavory way, stumbling into my kitchen, looking at my fridge saying "Hey, Glyn," opening the door, apologizing for the intrusion, and taking out a bottle of milk. The next part of this story involves me taking some harder drugs and screaming at the milk just furiously and throwing it against my wall.

Today was awesome.

name: spinynorman
text: My Dutch friend named my hanging plant Ned. Whenever he came over he would get a big grin on his face and yell, " OWZ IT HANGIN' NED?!? "

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i refuse to believe this is true...but it is almost too ridiculous to be lied about.

name: buttermoths
text: Yeah, that black bottle will make you boisterous and friendly, but in a way that will be too strong for some John Prine albums.

name: the_prophet
text: Oh God I'm out of chubbies, a sort of e.d.

name: norrin
text: I chubbied this not because I was that impressed but because I wanted to undo an undeserved lame.

name: javonathan
text: A comment left by javonathan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, diggydow, Thorfinn, Jesler729, SchnappM, goocifer, GeyserShitdick, chivalress, rowboat, DESTROY_YOU, Baryonyx, d3athcann0n, luckypyjamas, pr0ncess, Wulvaine, alejandroadam, iidebaser, blarghamagarky, Shinkicka)

text: Also, I think Ray was using his hands to exercise his biceps with a heavy typewriter.

text: Man but seriously the Xbox is gigantic.

name: thorfinn
text: Was it the first time you engaged in sex, or the first time it was enjoyable?

name: boredom_man
text: On the previous occasion he was boning a web site and was denied cookies by a close friend.

name: buttermoths
text: Heeey, you told us about that sex on the previous strip too! You ARE just hella postin' about the sex!

name: rowboat
text: Javonathan, thank you for helping me to understand that there really is a more reprehensible sort of comment than that of the "I'm in a band" variety. I was willing to allow your previous mention of this sexual encounter slide, but now I will lame you, leave a bitchy comment and remember to be wary of you in the future. That is all.

name: javonathan
text: please forgive me. it won't happen again. i swear.

name: loneal
text: It is okay, little javonathan! You were psyched about getting laid, is all. *pat pat*

name: lateadopter
text: Thanks, but we were pretty sure already that you would not get laid again.

name: javonathan
text: also, i'm in a band.

name: rowboat
text: Hey, don't worry about people like me, man. You just do your thing. I'm just sayin' how I feel. Besides, doin' it and playin' rock music are the raddest things. Especially when you're seventeen. I know this.

name: ilstefan
text: side effects of regular ketel one abuse include double visions, apathy, auditory hallucinations and implosion of the liver.

name: thorfinn
text: Side effects of regular Ketel One abuse include an empty wallet.  That stuff is expensive, man.  It is good though.

name: earendil
text:
Excerpt from the slightly less popular Understanding Maniacs2 - Inside the Mind of a Maniac by Google :
Maniacs are driven off by the FIA in the Ferrari Series Challenge. Maniacs often like to make a speaker box for a soldier.

name: paperboy_2000
text: With magical Mexican realism drapes, it's always about car crashes and dying mailmen.  If the drapes were really from Ibiza, they would lie to Ray about the mailman doing shots of absinthe and foam dancing in the neighbors driveway.

name: myrrdisparo
text: That would supply Ibiza's mailmen with interesting topics of conversation at parties

name: crawfomp
text: I applaud the amount of content in this strip, even if it doesn't push the standard "funny button."  Is it designed to make me think, or ask rhetorical questions?

name: rowboat
text: If this doesn't press your "funny button," you must be sober.

name: cousinted
text: I like to imagine that the voice of the drapes was recorded originally spoken backwards, but played back in reverse ala David Lynch.

name: buttermoths
text: Now that you mention it, those COULD be the drapes from The Black Lodge. Which probably means there is a midget behind it. Also a stork dancing with a blue-haired stripper unicorn.

name: usversusthem
text: Are the midget, the stork and the blue-haired stripper unicorn chilling with Beef's hidden marriage fees?

name: catgrl131
text:
Woohoo! Febuary 18th = My Birthday strip (And day before Steak Day.)! I feel so very special!

Also, I actually looked up today's Cathy, but sadly, the real strip was about how obnoxious it is to have an excess of remotes (ACK!).
Is worst strip, printed in ugliest newspaper.

name: buttermoths
text: You should check out The Comics Curmudgeon .

name: catgrl131
text:
I looked...
What was I supposed to find there?

name: buttermoths
text:
Yeah, Marmaduke Explained is indeed superior, but give the Curmudgeon time and it'll grow on you like a motherfucker.
catgrl131, I figured since you dislike stuff like Cathy you'd appreciate a web page dedicated to ridiculing horrors like that.

name: catgrl131
text:
Ahh, indeed Sweet.
Thank you!

name: shinealight
text: This seems to me like an knock-off of the superior Marmaduke Explained.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Comics curmudgeon is much more excellent that Marmaduke explained. Wait for a good spider-man or Judge Parker strip. Good times.

name: hardcorebrat
text: Chris Onstad you are my Lord and Saviour!

name: nickgranger
text: I like how this is a direct response to everyone getting on Onstad's case about being late, lately. Onstad:1 Us:0

text: Do you seriously think that this is the first time Onstad has burned us?

text: Does anyone remember the rock hard catcock debacle?

IT MAKES ME SO ANGRY

(less effective with fat mice than huge-faced roast beef)

text: Worth the wait. So worth the wait.

text: Ray shows some serious ethical chops for more or less owning up to killing that mailman.

text: Is tomorrow's "Steak Day" aside and separate from Steak and Blowjob Day which falls on March 14th? Or does tomorrow come with a blowjob too? I need to know these things in advance. You can't just have a blowjob suprise you on President's day.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I dunno, I think I'm ok with such a surprise.

name: twoply
text: It's a compliment!

text: src="http://a880.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/84/l_6eeac008e399d5f3d7e6483be0d64317.jpg" title="Philippe went viral." >

name: geysershitdick
text:
Damn, dude! Your gotta quit that html crap. We use bbcode here:

[IMGS OFF]

name: geysershitdick
text:
BBCODE like this: [img]www.wheretheimageisatontheinternet.com[\img]

Except use a backslash in the closing tag, not a forward slash.

name: twoply
text: Thank you. Goodnight!! [IMGS OFF]

name: rowboat
text:
Assetbar - 5
Twoply - 1

I feel your pain, my friend. But it's like watching a drunk on an icy sidewalk. I mean, you gotta laugh. It's not evil. You just have to.

name: budenhagen
text: Seriously, how hard is bbcode? 0 amount of hard, that's how hard. It's not hard, you use [] instead of <>, url instead of a, and img instead of oh wait

name: dovey
text: There there, twoply, there there.

name: chuvak
text: dude srsly, stop. you are bad at this.

name: kensai
text:
I laughed hardest at the primary character section.

Although technically Beef gets like one strip a year.

name: earendil
text: I think the thing is that Beef can only really be the main character in plot-driven strips, whereas Ray's personality is much more suited to one-offs.

name: autrepoupee
text: i thought steak day was march 14th ?

name: usversusthem
text: No. Steak is so awesome, it gets its own day as well as its own half-day. You're supposed to know this.

name: stonedlightning
text: A comment left by stonedlightning was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, vodkavonstroheim, augeno13)

name: decagon
text: The average maniac has, with tragic consequences, gone into a mania.

name: mikeleffel2
text:
Chris forgot to mention the savory dessert that is alt text.

What a woman's fart he is.

name: neonfreon
text: this is the only achewood strip i've ever understood

name: justa
text: "Handmaiden to an afternoon's despair" sounds like the name of a Goth band to me.

name: jbushnell
text: No, the first track on a "freak folk" album

name: vermy
text: What happened to Ray's Diary Crown?

name: loneal
text: It's not a diary crown, it's a gettin' mad rutty crown. If Ray had just gotten it on with the drapes or the dead cartero or something, I'm sure the crown would be in its proper place atop his head.

name: tel
text: Is it just me, or is Onstad's relationship with his fanbase kind of awkward? Maybe just a touch of resentment?

name: autrepoupee
text: i don't know, i personally don't see this as a huge dig at all, as much as it is a reference to the fact that yes, he did take longer than expected with this strip. more really a gag on himself. but then again, most all of my favorite media types pretty much treat their fans like so much stupid gum and i always come back because they can go ahead and cut me i cant even feel it anymore--- i loooove, love the PAIIIN !

name: jlaw
text: I really think Onstad is pretty respectful of his fans, considering he basically judges his comics by "will I find this funny" rather than "will the masses find this funny." He avoids a sense of patronizing and I would like to think he holds his fans (most of them at least) to a relatively high standard.

name: trollcollins
text: I was just scrolling through the 140 comments (why are there always >100 comments even when I first check?) to see if anyone had made a similar point. I get the sense of a thinly veiled disdain off this strip, and it makes me kind of sad. It seems like Onstad resents having to do the strip, or feels it's become formulaic, or something along those lines. I'm not saying he is. I could be completely wrong. It's that's just the sense I'm getting from this strip.

name: trollcollins
text: Oh, lord, "it's that's." PROOFREAD, self. PROOFREAD.

name: hereward
text: True in that the seed of this strip lies in Onstad having done Achewood for so long, but I don't sense much resentment or disdain, just good-natured joking about Achewood itself, of a sharpness and insight normally only seen in the most intelligent, witty and slightly cynical fan, not its creator - amazing.

name: powderfinger
text: Onstad seems to be handing out sass by the bagfull with this one.

name: massialot
text: Meta-achewood!

name: zem
text: holy shit this rules

name: l_c_b
text:
Oh, aren't we the sassy one Mr. Onstad.

Your day will come!

Honestly though, that last panel contains a Cathy-related image I didn't need.

name: suomichris
text: Best. Strip. Ever.

name: miseryandthesun
text: A comment left by miseryandthesun was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sneeeeeeeeeeeze, lawbot, Nictusempra)

name: odei
text: My wild and careless lifestyle means I can't chubby this (oh Louis!).

name: norrin
text: You are wrong.

name: falseprophet
text: Are you saying that it is in fact remotely funny or that he did not actually follow the directions as well as he could?

name: norrin
text: The funny end of the comment. I enjoyed the blushing Romano more than I can explain.

name: vandenbos
text: Hell of nicely played on the clownpenis.fart card.

name: ibetso
text: For inclusion of Louis Theroux alone you get a chubby. I love that man.

name: achilleselbow
text: I am so sorry. I will probably get lamed for this, but I just got home and was piss drunk reading this, and my cat walked on the keyboard, making the page scroll down to a random comment, and I remembered that Ray is a cat, and suddenly, somehow, life just made SENSE.

name: dwodles
text: That is... so good .

name: wittyname
text: Achewood: Now with Life-Assuring comments.

name: hellofyellin
text:
The Master transcends the medium. Truly artful meta-comicry.

A

A would read again.

name: hellofyellin
text:
The middle 'A' is to read

Aplusplus. Screw you AssetBar.

Fuck you.

name: usversusthem
text: It's okay man it's okay it's okay I saw what you were trying to do I had this mental image of an eBay feedback page with just thousands and thousands of green plusses and nonsensical comments and also at the same time those three guys from the front row of the Nice Pat/Animalicious concert It's okay man I swear it's gonna be okay

name: hellofyellin
text:
You forgot the hemorrhoid cream. That is another allusion I was making.

Use a period when you're being passive-aggressive.

name: usversusthem
text: Well, yes, but I was referring to the original post. And I was actually not being intentionally passive aggressive. I was just being melodramatically sympathetic cause I like being melodramatic sometimes.

name: hellofyellin
text: Ah, I see. My apologies.

text: strongest achewood I've read in a long long time

Yes.


Pity the poor man, as he has consigned himself to what must be the utter worst fate imaginable.

text: Morrisey/muffin tops/Roast Beef/a whispering eye/a pedometer enthusiast chasing a dog
